data.title: Lunch with the Kiddo
data.text: It's a real burger on a bun!!! The kids size burger is a bigggg burger, big enough for an adult!! Very tasty and cooked right. Fresh French fries. Liked the hometown feel to it.

data.title: Simple burgers
data.text: We like to come here whenever we are craving a nice juicy burger. This place is a no-frills joint. You place your order, fill up your own drinks, pick a table to wait for your order number to be called and dress your own burgers. Every time we go, the food is hot and the condiment bar looks fresh. Friendly service.

data.title: Interesting range of food choices
data.text: We went here with a group and got the basic burgers.  We did like that we could get tator tots instead of fries.  The burger was a little dry but as stated, there are other food that I would try next time.  something is did like is that you can get your own soda and tea refills as well as add all your own toppings from a topping bar.

data.title: Great shrimp
data.text: We went there twice while in Texas in April. He has fresh friend shrimp and they are good. His onion rings are good too. Prices are reasonable and we enjoy going here with Texas family. The building is nothing to look at, and there are no waitresses. You put your order in, pay for it, and he calls your number when it is ready.

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: We love the burgers. These guys were around way before the other chain burger joints. They have a fixens bar for anything you want to put on your burger. Enjoy

data.title: Local Best Kept Secret
data.text:
Y'all just need to give this place a try. You will return!
They have a huge selection of food so don't think hamburgers are your only choice. Try the Korean BBQ for a real treat.
Their burgers are awesome and they make their own bread, grind their own burger meat and just do it right.
This time we hosted a geocaching event that brought 43 people and there was not one complaint about the food quality.
Just give them a try and support local business. You can't go wrong.

data.title: Nice, quiet burger place
data.text: Very good burgers, quiet atmosphere and uniquely quality meats.  I like the build your own burger bar of condiments that has always been clean and fresh looking every time I've eaten there.  It has also been a good place to watch a ball game without having to put up with a bar atmosphere.  Good food.

data.title: OK But Not Great!!!
data.text: Stopped by today.  Nothing here to brag about!!  Burgers are dry.  I think they are pre-made.  Way to much bread for a bun.  You put on your own condiments and such.  They looked like they were out all day, and not fresh.  Fries are good.  Onion rings are home made.  Sweet potato fries were good.  That's about it.  Restaurant was clean and the counter help was friendly.  Probably won't be back...

data.title: Best Burgers in League City!
data.text: If you're looking for a tasty and filling burger, this is the place. I ordered the 1/3 pound burger and it was tender, juicy, and full of flavor. The homemade fresh bun and the fresh crisp vegetables just make it that much better. The meat is seasoned just right and requires no salt or pepper. It was good to the last bite! You should stop by and support a local family instead of a restaurant chain every now and then. You might even be surprised that the alternative is actually better.

data.title: Great burger!
data.text: My wife, 6 year old son and two host kids (5 and 8) visited tonight.  I had read good reviews here on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed!  The rest of the crew had regular burgers.  I tried a bite of my son's and it was delicious.  The bun is great and I have read they are homemade daily and they taste like it.  I had a Bulgogi burger which is Korean-style shredded beef marinated with their own sweet soy sauce, sort of like bbq sweet teriyaki.  It was very tasty!!  I had fries and my wife had onion rings.  The fries were good but nothing special.  I tried an onion ring and it was very good.  I've heard their sweet potato fries are good too.  The guy who took our order wasn't very friendly but not rude either.  I was surprised we were the only ones in the place on a Friday night, but it was before 6pm.  The prices were reasonable, the food was tasty and the place was clean.  I'd definitely come back again,

data.title: Fantastic burgers!!!
data.text: Great burgers in a small hometown restaurant! Think Fudruckers in a Kelly's but only half the size. Terrific French fries, healthy portions at a great price. Love this place!!!

data.title: Great burgers!
data.text: We've been coming here for years.  The food is great and so is the service. The owner makes the buns every day.  We were impressed when he was talking to us one day and told us he personally went to the ranch where he gets the meat.  He told us his children eat here and wanted to make sure the meat was coming from a safe place.  We LOVE the seasoning he makes for the fries.  We've tried several times to get him to sell it.  So far,  no luck.  I'll be the first one in line when he does!

data.title: Dress Your Own Burger
data.text: Located on League City's Main St. just a few blocks east of the Gulf Frwy, this Korean-owned burger house has been serving serious burgers for many years.  Pride of ownership is apparent in this clean, tidy family-run operation.  Burgers are made from good quality lean meat.  They have borrowed a couple ideas from Fuddrucker's, a Houston burger institution: the buns taste exactly like the fresh-baked ones at Fudd's and there is a salad bar where you dress your own burger just like you like it!

data.title: Like a mini-FuddRuckers, add your own sides to your burger - good!
data.text: We really like to add our own sides (they have a good selection), & that's how it's done here!  The burger are really good, made to order.  Kids meal is plenty for most women, even with a healthy appetite.  Fries & onions rings are really good.  We've gone here for years!

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Burgers are well seasoned and toppings are always fresh.  The service is quick and easy. Love the Korean BBQ sandwich when I am not in the mood for a burger!

data.title: Fuddruckerish on a small scale
data.text: The burgers here are very good and I prefer them to the well-known chain brands.  The buns are really good and pretty much like Fuddruckers buns.  The fixings you put on yourself from a bar like Fuddruckers also.  Great fries as well.  Friendly service.  They do have a drive through but I don't like to use it because the burgers are so big and juicy they are hard to eat in the car.

data.title: Best Burger near home
data.text: I wasn't expecting much judging from the outside but when you walk in, you order your burger either as 1/4, 1/3 or 1/2 pound and you pick the kind of beef you want. It's cooked to order and you add your "dressings" at the bar. This was a really good burger with really good fries.  In fact, I'd eat a burger here before Five Guys (even though I love the Five Guys beef) because the french fries were awesome.

data.title: Almost like a Fuddbuger
data.text: Burgers in third and half pounds portions. Your choice of cheeses and serve yourself veggies and condiments. All come out hot and ready to dress. Good value for what you get.
